content:
ActiveDesignSurfaceChangedEventHandler Delegate

Definition

Represents the method that will handle the ActiveDesignSurfaceChanged event of a DesignSurfaceManager. This class cannot be inherited.

In this Article

public delegate void ActiveDesignSurfaceChangedEventHandler(object sender, ActiveDesignSurfaceChangedEventArgs e);
Inheritance
Object
Delegate
ActiveDesignSurfaceChangedEventHandler

Remarks

When you create an ActiveDesignSurfaceChangedEventHandler delegate, you identify a method to handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see NIB: Events and Delegates.
